projet.frigo.A3

Class Arduino

  • java.lang.Object
    • projet.frigo.A3.Arduino
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Arduino
extends java.lang.Object
implements gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
    The class used to connect to the Arduino

    This class is used to connect to the Arduino. It implements SerialPortEventListener to register as a dispatcher, and then on each serialEvent it dispatch the data and sends it to the Model.

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Search for the port, connect to it, and add Event Listeners for the dispatch loop

      • close

        public void close()
        This should be called when you stop using the port. This will prevent port locking on platforms like Linux.

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(gnu.io.SerialPortEvent oEvent)
        Handle an event on the serial port. Read the data and interpret it.

        The Arduino sends the data under the following format:

        < Temperature > ; < Humidité > ; < Point de Rosée > \n

        This function read that from the event, dispatch it, and sends it to the Model.

        Specified by:
        serialEvent in interface gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
        Parameters:
        oEvent - Event data. See gnu.io.SerialPortEvent
